name: Charles S. MYERS and J. Lynn Myers, his wife, for themselves and on behalf of their minor children, Christine, Cassandra, C. Stacy, Charles S. Myers, III, Appellants, v. QUAKER STATE OIL REFINING CORPORATION, Appellee
name_abbreviation: Myers v. Quaker State Oil Refining Corp.
docket_number: Appeal No. 85 Western District Appeal Docket 1989

parties: Charles S. MYERS and J. Lynn Myers, his wife, for themselves and on behalf of their minor children, Christine, Cassandra, C. Stacy, Charles S. Myers, III, Appellants, v. QUAKER STATE OIL REFINING CORPORATION, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
This appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
Larsen, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: George M. Schroeck, Schroeck & Segel, P.C., Erie, for appellants.
Irving 0. Murphy, MacDonald, Illig, Jones and Britton, and S.E. Riley, Jr., Erie, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
582 A.2d 1313
Charles S. MYERS and J. Lynn Myers, his wife, for themselves and on behalf of their minor children, Christine, Cassandra, C. Stacy, Charles S. Myers, III, Appellants, v. QUAKER STATE OIL REFINING CORPORATION, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Sept. 28, 1990.
Decided Dec. 21, 1990.
George M. Schroeck, Schroeck & Segel, P.C., Erie, for appellants.
Irving 0. Murphy, MacDonald, Illig, Jones and Britton, and S.E. Riley, Jr., Erie, for appellee.
